comment: Smart Data models - Activity schema derived from the open connectivity foundation repository https://github.com/openconnectivityfoundation/IoTDataModels adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.OCF/master/Activity/schema.json
description: This Resource describes the Properties associated with a person's physical activity. All Properties are read-only values that are provided by the server. When range (from 'oic.r.baseresource') is omitted the default is 0 to +MAXFLOAT.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: ccal_day
contents.comment: This Property describes the burned off calories of user since the beginning of the day.

contents.name: ccal_day_precision
contents.comment: When exposed the value in 'precision' provides a +/- tolerance against the Properties in the Resource. Thus if a Property is UPDATED to a value and that Property then RETRIEVED, the RETRIEVED value is valid if in the range of the set value +/- precision

contents.name: ccal_day_step
contents.comment: Step value across the defined range an integer when the range is a number.  This is the increment for valid values across the range; so if range is 0.0..10.0 and step is 2.5 then valid values are 0.0,2.5,5.0,7.5,10.0.

contents.name: ccal_reset
contents.comment: This Property describes the burned off calories of user since the last reset.

contents.name: ccal_reset_precision
contents.comment: When exposed the value in 'precision' provides a +/- tolerance against the Properties in the Resource. Thus if a Property is UPDATED to a value and that Property then RETRIEVED, the RETRIEVED value is valid if in the range of the set value +/- precision

contents.name: ccal_reset_step
contents.comment: Step value across the defined range an integer when the range is a number.  This is the increment for valid values across the range; so if range is 0.0..10.0 and step is 2.5 then valid values are 0.0,2.5,5.0,7.5,10.0.

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: n
contents.comment: Friendly name of the Resource

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: steps_day
contents.comment: This Property describes the user's step count that measures the number of steps the user has taken since the beginning of the day.

contents.name: steps_day_step
contents.comment: Step value across the defined range when the range is an integer.  This is the increment for valid values across the range; so if range is 0..10 and step is 2 then valid values are 0,2,4,6,8,10.

contents.name: steps_reset
contents.comment: This Property describes the user's step count that measures the number of steps the user has taken since the last reset.

contents.name: steps_reset_step
contents.comment: Step value across the defined range when the range is an integer.  This is the increment for valid values across the range; so if range is 0..10 and step is 2 then valid values are 0,2,4,6,8,10.

contents.name: ccal_day_range
contents.comment: The valid range for the Property in the Resource as a number. The first value in the array is the minimum value, the second value in the array is the maximum value.

contents.name: ccal_reset_range
contents.comment: The valid range for the Property in the Resource as a number. The first value in the array is the minimum value, the second value in the array is the maximum value.

contents.name: if
contents.comment: The OCF Interface set supported by this Resource.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: rt
contents.comment: The Resource Type.

contents.name: steps_day_range
contents.comment: The valid range for the Property in the Resource as an integer. The first value in the array is the minimum value, the second value in the array is the maximum value.

contents.name: steps_reset_range
contents.comment: The valid range for the Property in the Resource as an integer. The first value in the array is the minimum value, the second value in the array is the maximum value.

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
